English

Introduction

A function trim() should be implemented which copies a part of a string into another by leaving leading and trailing blanks out.

If we consider the string 

"   This string can be trimmed  .     "

the trimmed version of it would be 

"This string can be trimmed  ."

Assignment

  1. Find a minimal value for the constant STRLEN in test_trim.cpp such that all unit tests can run without any memory corruption.
  2. Explain in a further comment what would happen if you would choose a too small value for this constant.
  3. Implement the function trim() such that all unit tests pass.
  4. Refactor trim() such that it calls at least another function.
  5. Explain in a comment above how you were able to limit the scope of this function and why you did this.
  6. Create a new file trim_str.cpp add a main() function and adapt the makefile in way such that the trim_str.cpp is built and called if the target "make all" (or simply "make") is called instead of "make test".
  7. Implement the newly created main() function such that it accpets a string as command line argument and
    1. Stage 1: prints the command line arguments via printf().
    2. Stage 2: copies the command line arguments via strcpy() or sprintf() or character by character (a method you did not use when implmenting trim()) into a newly declared character array of length 512.
    3. Stage 3: calls the function trim() and outputs the result into the stdout.
